title: Ticket #6388: Missing OSG default env on EL7
description:
From https://jira.opensciencegrid.org/browse/SOFTWARE-2872 (with alternative solution attached to the JIRA ticket as a patch):

On EL6, we package /usr/share/osg/sysconfig/condor but neither this file, nor an equivalent, are in the EL7 packaging due to this stanza. The proper way to do this in systemd is to create /usr/lib/systemd/system/condor.service.d/osg-env.conf with the contents: 

[Service]
Environment=LLGT_LOG_IDENT=Condor-lcmaps
Environment=LCMAPS_DB_FILE=/etc/lcmaps.db
Environment=LCMAPS_POLICY_NAME=authorize_only
# Condor does not want LCMAPS to change user for it
Environment=LLGT_LIFT_PRIVILEGED_PROTECTION=1
#level 0: no messages, 1: errors, 2: also warnings, 3: also notices,
#  4: also info, 5: maximum debug
Environment=LCMAPS_DEBUG_LEVEL=2

The annoying thing about this is we'd have two different files that contain the same env for two different init systems
